title: The Set Sanctuary
story: Sets are collections of unique elements - no duplicates allowed! They're perfect for removing duplicates, testing membership, and performing mathematical set operations like union and intersection.
instructions: Create a set `numbers` from the list [1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5]. Add the number 6 to the set using add(). Create a variable `set_size` with the length of the set. Print the set and its size.
solutionHidden:
numbers = set([1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5])
numbers.add(6)
set_size = len(numbers)
print(numbers)
print(set_size)

hints.text: Create set from list: set([list]). Sets automatically remove duplicates
Use set.add(item) to add new element. Use len(set) for size
